newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS -CALL SPREAD SOLD IN ICI.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS -CALL SPREAD SOLD IN ICI.

text.p: A bear spread in Imperial Chemical Industries was one of the larger deals in the stock options market by early afternoon on Wednesday, dealers said.
It involved selling 500 October 900 calls at 180p and buying 500 October 1100 calls at 40p for a net credit of 140p.
For maximum profit of 140p at expiry, the underlying shares need to fall below 900p. If the shares go above 1100p, the spread will make a maximum loss of 60p.
By 1300 GMT, ICI shares was down 33-1/2p to 1075p.
British Telecommunications were also active with a seller of around 1,400 August 385 puts at 5-1/2p.
In a separate trade in BT, 1,000 August 425 calls were crossed at 3-1/2p.
Dealers believed the deals may have been closing trades ahead of the stock options expiry on August 20.
Elsewhere, there was seller of 350 August 320 calls at prices of 31p-33p in aero-engine maufacturer Rolls Royce, which also may have been a closing deal.
Rolls Royce shares were down 6-1/2p to 252p.
